security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown instructions for frontend development. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access capabilities. The skill guides AI agents on development workflows using standard development tools locally.

content.value_statement: Frontend development requires following specific project conventions, testing standards, and build processes. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for implementing Next.js/React features with proper component architecture, API integration, and test coverage.
actual_capabilities: Implement Next.js App Router pages with proper directory structure
Create Presentational and Container components following project conventions
Integrate APIs using Orval-generated clients with proper error handling
Write unit tests with Vitest and Testing Library achieving 80% coverage
Apply shadcn/ui components and styling with Tailwind CSS
Run lint checks, tests, and builds to verify code quality
limitations: This is a guidance skill that assists developers; it does not execute code directly
Requires an existing Next.js/React project structure to follow
Assumes access to local development tools (pnpm, Node.js)

use_cases.title: Build new features
use_cases.description: Implement new pages and components following project conventions with proper testing

use_cases.title: Create UI components
use_cases.description: Develop reusable Presentational components with Storybook and testing

use_cases.title: Implement test coverage
use_cases.description: Write unit and integration tests for React components using Vitest

prompt_templates.title: New page request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new dashboard page at views/dashboard/ with user statistics display. Include a Container component that fetches data using the Orval API client and Presentational components for the UI. Write Vitest tests with 80% coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Component creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a reusable UserCard component using shadcn/ui Card. Create the component in components/UserCard/ with index.tsx, index.test.tsx, and index.stories.tsx. Apply tablet-first responsive design.

prompt_templates.title: Form implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a contact form using React Hook Form and Zod validation. Use shadcn/ui Form components. Include proper error handling and loading states. Write tests for validation and submission.

prompt_templates.title: API integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Integrate the user profile API. Create a useUserProfile custom hook that handles loading, error, and success states. Use the Orval-generated client. Write tests with MSW mock handlers.

best_practices: Always check existing shadcn/ui components before creating new ones
Separate Presentational (UI) and Container (logic) components clearly
Run lint, tests, and build locally before reporting completion
anti_patterns: Using any type instead of unknown for type safety
Mixing business logic with UI rendering in same component
Skipping test coverage requirements for faster delivery

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires pnpm, Node.js, and Next.js project.

faq.question: What testing frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Vitest for unit tests, Testing Library for behavior tests, MSW for API mocking.

faq.question: Can this skill create full-stack features?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on frontend. Backend API integration uses pre-generated Orval clients.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill. All code runs locally in your development environment.

faq.question: Why is my build failing?
faq.answer: Check Biome lint errors, TypeScript strict mode issues, and ensure all imports are used. Run 'pnpm lint:check' locally.

faq.question: How does this compare to other frontend skills?
faq.answer: This skill enforces specific project conventions including component structure, testing requirements, and coding standards.
